sn47.30:4.2: Now at that time the householder Mānadinna was sick, suffering, gravely ill.
sn47.30:4.5: “Sir, I’m not keeping well, I’m not alright.
sn47.30:4.6: The pain is terrible and growing, not fading,
sn47.30:4.7: its growing, not fading, is apparent.
sn47.30:4.8: When I experience such painful feelings I meditate by observing an aspect of the body, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.30:4.9: I meditate by observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.30:4.11: principles, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.30:4.12: And of the five lower fetters taught by the Buddha, I don’t see any that I haven’t given up.”
sn47.30:4.14: You have declared the fruit of non-return.”
